When reviewing a pull request:
- Check that the pull request contains a line with "Closes #" that references an issue in the issue tracker.
- Check that the pull request contains a good description of the changes that were made.
- Check that the changes in the pull request addresses the changes requested in the issue identified in the "Closes #" line.
- Do not consider the pull request title or description in deciding if the changes in the pull request address the changes requested in the issue.
- Check that the changes in the pull request do not make any changes other than those requested by the issue identified in the "Closes #" line.

- Do not comment on the inconsistency in the lyrics where sheep are described as making cow sounds in the OldMacDonald.md file.

- Do not suggest checking that the change from "world" to "earth" in the TwinkleTwinkle.md file is intentional.
